title: Gemma Collins breaks her silence after James Argent drama
text:
Gemma Collins has broken her silence after having to call 999 to check on James Argent

Gemma Collins took to Instagram to thank one of her friends for bringing round a bouquet of lilies after she was apparently forced to call 999 over concerns for on-off boyfriend James Argent’s welfare.

The Towie star, 38, shared a video of her friend putting the flowers in a vase for her, writing: ‘Thank you Jaymey McIvor’.

Arg was said to have been left ‘embarrassed’ by the situation on Thursday, after police were called to his house to check on his welfare after he failed to reply to calls and texts from friends and family.

Arg told The Sun: ‘I wasn’t speaking to a certain person so I didn’t reply. They became concerned and called the police and ambulance.

‘They turned up and checked on me. They came up to my room to make sure I was fine.

‘I wasn’t speaking to this person for a reason and they were worried about my safety because I wasn’t answering the phone.’

He claimed his parents were already at the house with him, and the three of them were busy hanging pictures on the walls.

Gemma thanked her friend for bringing a bouquet of lilies to her house (Picture: Instagram)

‘I was perfectly fine, we all had a chat and carried on the day with my parents, we were just hanging up pictures,’ he added.

‘The police and paramedics were only here for about 10 minutes. I’m slightly embarrassed really. I apologise for any wasted police time as I was absolutely fine.’

The Metropolitan Police added: ‘Police were called at 13.11hrs to a residential address following concerns for the welfare of male occupant. Officers attended with LAS.

‘The male, in his 30s, was spoken to. He was left in the company of family. Officers were called at 16.21hrs to the same address, again due to concerns for the same male’s welfare. The male declined assistance.’

Arg has also revealed that he will be heading to Spain for a gig this week as well as sharing some cleaning products he had been sent for his new home.
